metadata.title: CVE-2020-35525 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In SQlite 3.31.1, a potential null pointer derreference was found in theINTERSEC query processing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.6
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.6
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.6
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
sqlite3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1ubuntu0.6').
